radiographic_examinations.findings: small, bilateral pleural effusions, with no consolidation or pneumothorax

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: New, extensive hypoattenuation in the periventricular and subcortical white matter, sulcal effacement, and marked expansion of the corpus callosum occurred on contrast-enhanced CT performed 5 days later, indicating brain swelling and edema.

radiographic_examinations.findings: interval progression of diffuse cerebral swelling, with new, diffuse hemispheric sulcal effacement and development of descending transtentorial herniation
